subTitle: Break On Through!
definition: I'll get you up to speed with moving around the charting space. Let's deal with the slider first!
callOut: Click and drag it down to close the design space and open the charting space. Do the opposite for the reversed effect. Now, hit <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> + <kbd>Shift</kbd> + <kbd>↑</kbd> and try <kbd>←</kbd> <kbd>→</kbd> <kbd>↓</kbd> too!
note: Unless you need both spaces to be partially open, it's always a good idea to close either of them fully, to save computing resources in your machine.

subTitle: Time to Take Control!
definition: Yes! You may use your keyboard too! You are going to love this for long-distance travel on the design space!
paragraph1: Here's the trick: regular folks may use the <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> key plus the arrow keys: <kbd>←</kbd> <kbd>→</kbd> <kbd>↑</kbd> <kbd>↓</kbd>
tip: Of course Mac fanboys and fangirls must replace <kbd>Ctrl</kbd> with <kbd>Command</kbd>
